title: 111_hr5647
content: The Act is titled the "Responsible COBRA, Unemployment, and Poverty Extension Act" and includes provisions for extending unemployment insurance. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of different Acts related to unemployment benefits, changing dates from June 2, 2010, to September 30, 2010, and from November 6, 2010, to March 1, 2011. The text chunk discusses amending the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 to change dates from November 6, 2010, to March 1, 2011, and includes details on funding and effective date. SEC. 3. EXTENSION AND IMPROVEMENT OF PREMIUM ASSISTANCE FOR COBRA BENEFITS. Extension of Eligibility Period for COBRA benefits from May 31, 2010, to September 30, 2010, with additional rules for individuals experiencing qualifying events related to termination of employment after June 1, 2010. The amendments made by this section extend COBRA benefits eligibility period and apply to all continuation coverage, including State programs. The effective date is retroactive to the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. SEC. 4 extends the use of 2009 poverty guidelines until September 30, 2010. SEC. 5 rescinds $27 billion from unobligated funds under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 to offset increased spending. SEC. 6 requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to report the amounts rescinded to congressional committees. SEC. 6. DETERMINATION OF BUDGETARY EFFECTS. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Act is designated as an emergency for pay-as-you-go principles and statutory paygo requirements.
